mdRecord.dcterms:title: Virginia Republican leaders conclude committee meeting in Staunton, Va.; one-story house damaged by fire and overheated stove causes house fire in Roanoke, Va.; house destroyed by oil stove explosion in Martinsville, Va.; grocery store owner donates food and clothes to mining families in Wise County, Va.
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Patronage Committee members at the Virginia Republican State Central Committee meeting in Staunton privately discuss recommendations for federal judgeship candidates. Roanoke firefighters try to put out a fire in a one-story house, then they attempt to extinguish a different house fire started in a second-story bedroom by an overheated stove. Martinsville firefighters attempt to put out the flames of a house fire but are unable to stop it from burning down completely. Grocery store owner Ralph Campbell and a young boy pack boxes of canned goods and clothes to deliver to unemployed miners and their families in Derby (Wise County, Va.)
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Virginia--Politics and government
Fires
